about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.text: White lines between lanes indicate that the lanes are traveling in the same direction. Broken white line markings indicate that it is legal to pass another vehicle when safe.

suggestedAnswer.text: You must stay within your lane.

comment.text: You must stay within your lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: You may cross the centerline to change lanes.

comment.text: You may cross the centerline to change lanes.

suggestedAnswer.text: You may change lanes only from the left lane.

comment.text: You may change lanes only from the left lane.

acceptedAnswer.text: You may cross the centerline to change lanes.

comment.text: You may cross the centerline to change lanes.

hasPart.assesses: You are entering a freeway. Check traffic on the freeway by: | You are entering a freeway. Check traffic on the freeway by: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When entering any roadway, you must be aware of traffic conditions. Use your side mirror and look over your shoulder to help you see and anticipate traffic when entering a freeway.

suggestedAnswer.text: Using your rearview and side mirrors.

comment.text: Using your rearview and side mirrors.
Using your rearview mirror.

suggestedAnswer.text: Using your side mirror and looking over your shoulder.

comment.text: Using your side mirror and looking over your shoulder.

acceptedAnswer.text: Using your side mirror and looking over your shoulder.

hasPart.name: It is legal to drive with an alcoholic beverage container that has been opened only if the container is:

about.name: It is legal to drive with an alcoholic beverage container that has been opened only if the container is:

hasPart.assesses: It is legal to drive with an alcoholic beverage container that has been opened only if the container is: | It is legal to drive with an alcoholic beverage container that has been opened only if the container is: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Any opened alcoholic beverage container must be kept in the trunk of the vehicle, or in another place where passengers do not sit. Keeping an opened alcoholic drink in the glove compartment is specifically prohibited. However, in a bus, taxi, camper, or motor home, these restrictions do not apply to non-driving passengers.

comment.text: Under the front seat.
In the glove department.
In the trunk.
In the trunk.

answerExplanation.text: Any opened alcoholic beverage container must be kept in the trunk of the vehicle, or in another place where passengers do not sit. Keeping an opened alcoholic drink in the glove compartment is specifically prohibited. However, in a bus, taxi, camper, or motor home, these restrictions do not apply to non-driving passengers.

comment.text: It is legal to drive with an alcoholic beverage container that has been opened only if the container is: | Any opened alcoholic beverage container must be kept in the trunk of the vehicle, or in another place where passengers do not sit. Keeping an opened alcoholic drink in the glove compartment is specifically prohibited. However, in a bus, taxi, camper, or motor home, these restrictions do not apply to non-driving passengers.

hasPart.name: This yellow sign means:
hasPart.assesses: This yellow sign means: | This yellow sign means: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Some warning signs have a fluorescent yellow-green background. These signs warn of upcoming conditions, including roads with curves and sharp turns.

suggestedAnswer.text: There is a sharp turn to the right.

comment.text: There is a sharp turn to the right.
The lane must turn right.

suggestedAnswer.text: A right turn is permitted on a green arrow only.

comment.text: A right turn is permitted on a green arrow only.

acceptedAnswer.text: There is a sharp turn to the right.

comment.text: There is a sharp turn to the right.

hasPart.name: What is a crosswalk?
hasPart.assesses: What is a crosswalk? | What is a crosswalk? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Pedestrian crosswalks are often shown by white, solid lines to emphasize pedestrian crossing points. Crosswalks may have additional lines between the white, solid lines or in place of the parallel lines. However, crosswalks may also be unmarked.

suggestedAnswer.text: Another name for a four-way intersection.

comment.text: Another name for a four-way intersection.

suggestedAnswer.text: An area designated for road construction workers.

comment.text: An area designated for road construction workers.

suggestedAnswer.text: The area where pedestrians may cross the roadway.

comment.text: The area where pedestrians may cross the roadway.

acceptedAnswer.text: The area where pedestrians may cross the roadway.

comment.text: The area where pedestrians may cross the roadway.

answerExplanation.text: Pedestrian crosswalks are often shown by white, solid lines to emphasize pedestrian crossing points. Crosswalks may have additional lines between the white, solid lines or in place of the parallel lines. However, crosswalks may also be unmarked.

comment.text: What is a crosswalk? | Pedestrian crosswalks are often shown by white, solid lines to emphasize pedestrian crossing points. Crosswalks may have additional lines between the white, solid lines or in place of the parallel lines. However, crosswalks may also be unmarked.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: What is a crosswalk? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions

hasPart.text: If you have been parked on the side of a road, you must yield to existing traffic when re-entering the road.

suggestedAnswer.text: Continue waiting and yielding to traffic in the lane.

comment.text: Continue waiting and yielding to traffic in the lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slowly inch your vehicle into the traffic lane.

comment.text: Slowly inch your vehicle into the traffic lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: Drive on the shoulder until a gap in traffic appears.

comment.text: Drive on the shoulder until a gap in traffic appears.

acceptedAnswer.text: Continue waiting and yielding to traffic in the lane.

comment.text: Continue waiting and yielding to traffic in the lane.

answerExplanation.text: If you have been parked on the side of a road, you must yield to existing traffic when re-entering the road.
